task.title: Replace a power supply unit in a SolidFire chassis
task.shortdesc: Each SolidFire chassis includes two power supply units for power redundancy. If a power supply unit fails, you must replace it as soon as possible to ensure that the chassis has a redundant power source.

ul.li: You have determined that the power supply unit has failed.
You have a replacement power supply unit.
You have verified that the second power supply unit is operating.
You have an electrostatic discharge (ESD) wristband, or you have taken other antistatic precautions.

context.p:
The instructions in this document apply if you have a one-rack unit (1U) chassis with any of the following storage and Fibre Channel models:
SF2405
SF3010
SF4805
SF6010
SF9605
SF9608
SF9010
SF19210
SF38410
SF-FCN-01
FC0025
The following figure shows the back of a typical chassis with the two power supply units:

image.alt: In this figure, the two power supply units at the back of an SF9010 chassis are shown.

context.p: The location of the power supply units might vary depending on the hardware model.

step.cmd: Unplug the power cord from the power supply unit that you are replacing.
Press the release button to slide the power supply unit out of the chassis.

info.note: Ensure that you use both hands to support the weight of the power supply unit.

step.cmd: Using both hands, align the edges of the replacement power supply unit with the opening in the chassis, and gently push the unit into the chassis.

info.note: Do not use excessive force when sliding the power supply unit into the chassis to prevent damage to the hardware.

step.cmd: Return the failed unit to NetApp by following the instructions in the box that was shipped to you.
step.info: You can contact NetApp Support for help with the replacement procedure.
